Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery closed vessel, amphora or oinochoe; yellowish slip; exterior: animal procession consisting grazing goats (only head, part of one antler and one foreleg of one and one hind leg of second remaining) to right; dashes, quatrefoil, and hooked swastikas as filling ornament; below, black band and part of lower frieze - antlers of goat to left; dashes as filling ornament; at right, possibly more antlers.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 36, pl. 22, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.052)
